abaddon_description: One letter to a three-element group of ¥, µ, þ
about_notfornazis: Not for nazis, racists and fascists!
adfgvx_description: German Military Code from World War I.
alphabet_name_polish1_description: A Ą B C Ć D E Ę F G H I J K L Ł M N Ń O Ó P R S Ś T U W Y Z Ź Ż
alphabetvalues_description: Letter to their position in the alphabet
alphabetvalues_edit_mode_customize_delet: Do you really want to delete alphabet '%s1'?
alphabetvalues_edit_mode_customize_addle: Do you want to replace the value of letter '%s1'?
alphabetvalues_edit_mode_customize_delet:
Do you really want to remove the letter '%s1' from the current alphabet?

Chose 'Remove' for simple removing. Chose 'Remove and adjust' to adjust all following values with -1.
astronomy_sunriseset_description: Rise, Transit, Set, Twilights of a specific Date
astronomy_sunposition_description: Position of Sun of a specific Date and Time (Azimuth, Altitude, ...)
astronomy_moonriseset_description: Rise, Transit, Set of a specific Date
astronomy_moonposition_description: Position of the Moon (Azimuth, Altitude, ...) + Phase (Age, Illumination, ...)
astronomy_easter_easterdate_description: Date of Easter Sunday for a specific year (between 1583 and 3042)
astronomy_easter_easteryears_description: All years with a specific Easter Sunday Date (between 1583 and 3042)
astronomy_seasons_description: Date and time of beginning of seasons, reaching closest and farthest distance to sun in a year (between -1000 and 3000)
bacon_description: Letters to five-element groups of A and B
beaufort_description: Converts wind speed into Beaufort value (Scale up to Bft. 17)
brainfk_description: Esoteric Programming language with 8 characters, incl. its derivat 'Ook'
bifid_description: Cipher based on a square with an additional transposition
binary_description: Convert binary numbers into decimal numbers
caesar_description: Shifts letters on standard alphabet by 13 p(ROT-13)
callforcontribution_1: GCWizard is a tool from Geocachers for Geocachers.
callforcontribution_2: The developers and contributers created it completely during their free time. But such a huge app needs many months of hard work. This is a very hard job for just a few workers.
callforcontribution_4: You would like to help us? You can contribute anything to the project? That's awesome! Absolutely every single help and contribution is appreciated!
callforcontribution_5: You can help us with the development?
callforcontribution_6: The GCWizard is an Open Source tool. The code source is free and available on
callforcontribution_8: . Especially, we would love to get help with:
callforcontribution_10: Furthermore, we publish the GCWizard also on iOS. So, maybe you are an
callforcontribution_12: or you can donate a (not too) old MacBook? This would help to support GCWizard for iPhone users much better.
callforcontribution_15: can take over a task. We'll surely find one for you: What about
callforcontribution_21: ? Maybe you want to do some
callforcontribution_23:
at a social media platform?

Don't hesitate to ask us:
callforcontribution_25: Let GCWizard become a community project!
ccitt2_description: Baudot Murray Code; Binary Punched Tape Encoding

colors_description: Color Picker and Color Space Converter
combinatorics_combination_example: ABC → A B C AB AC BC ABC
combinatorics_permutation_example: ABC → ABC BAC CBA BCA ACB CAB
combinatorics_combinationpermutation_des: All subgroups and arrangements of characters
combinatorics_combinationpermutation_exa: ABC → A B C AB AC BA BC CA CB ABC ACB BAC BCA CAB CBA
common_clipboard_notextdatafound: No text data found in clipboard
common_support_title: Do you want to support us?
common_support_text:
You opened the GC Wizard %s1 times.

Thank you so much for using it!

- Do like to support us with a coffee?
- Do you want to contribute own content?
coords_common_clipboard_nocoordsfound: No coordinates found within the paste data.
coords_waypointprojection_description: Calculates destination point from start using bearing and distance
coords_distancebearing_description: Distance between 2 points and bearing from and to start
coords_intersecttwocircles_description: Calculates 2 intersection points of 2 circles (defined by center point and radius)
coords_intersectthreecircles_description: Calculates up to 6 intersection points (and the one common point) of 3 circles (defined by center point and radius)
coords_intersectbearingcircle_descriptio: Calculates 2 intersections points of a line and a circle (defined by bearing from one point and a center point with its radius)
coords_intersectbearings_description: Calculates the intersection point of 2 bearings from 2 points
coords_intersectfourpoints_title: Intersection of Line from Four Points
coords_intersectfourpoints_description: Calculates the intersection point of 2 lines defined by 4 points
coords_centertwopoints_description: Calculates the center point between 2 points
coords_centerthreepoints_description: Calculates the center point between 3 points (all points have the same distance to result)
coords_crossbearing_description: From one point the bearings to 2 given ones are known; Calculates this point
coords_formatconverter_description: Converts different coordinate formats into another
coords_intersection_description: From 2 given points the angles between the bearing to each other and a 3ʳᵈ one are known; Calculates the 3ʳᵈ point
coords_equilateraltriangle_description: Calculates the point from 2 given ones with: All points have to same distance to each other
coords_ellipsoidtransform_description: Transforms a coordinate from one rotation ellipsoid to another (available only for a few ellipsoids)
coords_resection_description: From one point, the angle between the bearings to 3 given points are known; Calculates this point
coords_variablecoordinate_description: Interpolates variables and calculates possible coordinates
coords_variablecoordinate_nooutputs:
No coordinates calculated!

Reasons may be:
- invalid/unparseable coordinate format
- subformulas need to be wrapped into [ ]
- missing variables
- North's N/East's E handled as variables and therefore replaced (Try 'N [value] E [value]' or remove N/E and replace S/W with Minus)
- negative or decimal result in a subformula
- Reverse projection found no result
coords_variablecoordinate_alert_text:
You generated %s1 coordinates.

Do you want to see them?

This might slow down you device dramatically.
crosssum_crosssum_description: Cross Sums of an Integer (incl. Digital root, alternated)
crosssum_range_description: Finds all integers within a range with a specific digit sum
deadfish_description: Esoteric Programming language with 4 characters (IDSO or XKCD)
deletealert_text: Do you really want to remove '%s1'?
duckspeak_description: A fun language made up of 'nak' sounds
duckspeak_example: Duck → Nak? Nak? Naknaknak nak? Naknak Nanananak Naknak nanak
enigma_description: German Military Encryption Machine in World War II.
formulasolver_description: Create formulas for stations and finals, add variables, solve them
gccode_decription: Converts the GC Code of a Geocache into its internal ID (Base31)
gronsfeld_description: Special case of Vigenère encryption with numbers as key
irrationalnumbers_nooccurrence: Value not found in the first %s1 digits.
irrationalnumbers_nthdecimal_description: Returns the nᵗʰ decimal digit (max. 1 000 000 digits)
irrationalnumbers_decimalrange_descripti: Returns m decimal digits from the nᵗʰ digit (max. 1 000 000 digits)
irrationalnumbers_search_description: Searches a certain occurence of number groups within the first 1 000 000 digits
kamasutra_description: Default: ROT-13; Customized with own alphabet: rotation by half of alphabet length
kenny_description: One letter to a three-element group of m, p, f; inspired by 'South Park'
mainmenu_callforcontribution_title: Would you like to help us?
numeralbases_description: Converts numbers between different radix (e.g. hexadecimal or binary to decimal)
periodictable_description: Shows data to chemical elements, sort them by categories
periodictable_comment_massnotexact: Atomic mass is often not correctly determinable for radioactive elements
periodictable_comment_noblegases: Noble gases mostly do not have any electronegativity
periodictable_comment_mayreactwithf: Under extrem circumstances reactions with F
periodictable_comment_densityvaries: Density/Melting point/Boiling point hardly fluctuate in various sources or are unknown
periodictable_comment_mostcommonisotop: Most common isotope not determinable, so isotope with highest half-life is given
periodictable_comment_c: Sublimates at 3642°C/6588°F; values are for diamond; for graphite: MP 3675°C/6647°F, BP 4026°C/7279°F, density 2.26
periodictable_comment_p: Density P white: 1.83, red: 2.0-2.4, black: 2.69; shown BP is for P white
periodictable_comment_as_1: Sublimates at 613°C/1135°F, melts only under high pressure
periodictable_comment_tc: Only very least quantities are natural, mostly synthetic
periodictable_comment_la: Some sources count La to Lanthanoides
periodictable_comment_os: Exact values vor MP/BP not possible; MP: 3400 +- 50K, BP: 5300 +- 100K
periodictable_comment_at: In many sources density is unknown
periodictable_comment_ac: Some sources count Ac to Actinoids
periodictable_comment_rg: In 2004 Unununium (Uuu) has been renamed into Rg
periodictable_comment_cn_1: In 2010 Ununbium (Uub) has been renamed into Cn
periodictable_comment_fl: In 2012 Ununquadium (Uuq) has been renamed into Fl
periodictable_comment_lv: In 2012 Ununhexium (Uuh) has been renamed into Lv
periodictable_comment_nh: In 2016 Ununtrium (Uut) has been renamed into Nh
periodictable_comment_og: In 2016 Ununoctium (Uuo) has been renamed into Og
periodictable_comment_mc: In 2016 Ununpentium (Uup) has been renamed into Mc
periodictable_comment_ts: In 2016 Ununseptium (Uus) has been renamed into Ts
playfair_example: AM EF KP RC PQ CW CB
primes_selection_description: Tools for prime numbers (for all primes up to 1 000 000)
primes_isprime_example: 3 IS prime! 42 is NOT a prime number!
primes_noprime: Value is NOT a prime number.
primes_nearestprime_description: Returns the nearest prime to any number
primes_integerfactorization_description: Returns the prime factorization of a number
railfence_description: Cipher written diagonally on rails of an imaginary fence (transposition)
romannumbers_description: Roman numbers with and without subtraction rule
rotation_rot13_description: Shifts letters by 13 (half of the alphabet)
rotation_rot18_description: Shifts letters by 13 and numbers by 5 (combination of ROT-13 and ROT-5)
rotation_rot47_description: Shifts characters by 47 over all ASCII characters from 33 to 126 (including A-Z, a-z, 0-9 and some special characters)
scienceandtechnology_selection_descripti: Maths, physics, chemistry, engineering, astronomy, weather, ...
scrabble_description: Letters to Scrabble value or their frequency values
segmentdisplay_selection_description: Encoding and decoding of 7, 14 or 16 segment displays
skytale_description: Write words on a leather band wrapped around a stick (transposition)
substitution_description: Replaces any character or group of character with another
symboltables_selection_description: Symbols that represent letters or numbers
symboltables_daedric_description: From the video game 'The Elder Scrolls'
symboltables_flags_german_kriegsmarine_d: Flag alphabet from the former German 'War Navy'
symboltables_fonic_description: From the video game 'Tales of the Abyss'
symboltables_gnommish_description: From the 'Artemis Fowl' books by Eoin Colfer
symboltables_hexahue_description: Every character represented by 3x2 colored pixels
symboltables_hylian_skyward_sword_descri: From the video game 'The Legend of Zelda: Skyward Sword'
symboltables_klingon_description: Text symbols of the Klingons from 'Star Trek'
symboltables_lorm_description: Hand and finger based alphabet for deaf-blind people
symboltables_marain_description: Sci-Fi language created by Iain M. Banks for his books, Version 1
symboltables_marain_v2_description: Sci-Fi language created by Iain M. Banks for his books, Version 2
symboltables_postnet_description: Barcode of the United States Postal Service USPS
symboltables_romulan_description: Text symbols of the Romulans from 'Star Trek'
symboltables_semaphore_description: Visual signals with two hand-held flags
symboltables_sign_description: Finger and hand signs for the deaf people
tapcode_description: A special case of the Polybios cipher
tapir_description: Code of the former East German military (NVA) and intelligence service (StaSi)
unitconverter_description: Converts values from one unit into another
vigenere_description: Shifts letters by the letter value of the key
